question.title: When using WebFluxLinkBuilder LocalDate is not encoded correctly
question.body:
I'm trying to migrate a project of mine to WebFlux from MVC and I'm having an issue when encoding links using the WebFluxLinkBuilder to a method that take in a LocalDate, the link shows the data as "12%2F02%2F2025" rather than "2020-02-12".

My code:

@GetMapping("test/{date}")
fun test(@PathVariable date: LocalDate?): Mono<ResponseEntity<EntityModel<*>>> = Mono
    .fromCallable { date }
    .subscribeOn(Schedulers.boundedElastic())
    .map { EntityModel.of( object { val date = it } ) }
    .flatMap { linkTo(octopusLinkBuilder.test(date)).withSelfRel().toMono().map { link -> it.add(link) } }
    .map { ResponseEntity.ok(it)

This produces the output

$ curl https://localhost:8898/api/test/2025-02-12
{
    "date" : "2025-02-12",
    "_links" : {
        "self" : {
            "href" : https://localhost:8898/api/test/12%2F02%2F2025"
        }
    }
}

I've tried using blocking calls, that does produce the correctly formatted date but strips off the scheme and hostname:

    @GetMapping("test/{date}")
fun test(@PathVariable date: LocalDate?): Mono<ResponseEntity<EntityModel<*>>> = Mono
    .fromCallable { date }
    .subscribeOn(Schedulers.boundedElastic())
    .map { EntityModel.of( object { val date = it } ) }
    .map { linkTo(octopusLinkBuilder.test(date)).withSelfRel().toMono().map { link -> it.add(link) }.block()!! }
    .map { ResponseEntity.ok(it) }

This gives the following output

$ https://localhost:8898/api/test/2025-02-12
{
    "date" : "2025-02-12",
    "_links" : {
        "self" : {
            "href" : "/api/test/2025-02-12"
        }
    }
}

I also get exactly the same response if I dispense with the ResponeEntity altogether.

I am new to WebFlux, have I fundamentally misunderstood something?

question_comments.body: Turns out it was me, you need a WebFluxConfigurer and tell it to use ISO formatted dates, as described in the documentation here: link
